flyash_classification: Low-calcium fly ash per ASTM C618
description: Fly ash from coal combustion used as supplementary cementitious material
data_source: XRF/XRD analysis from experimental study (相关参数)
loss_on_ignition_note: Remaining percentage includes minor oxides, unburned carbon, and LOI

phase_descriptions.glass: Amorphous aluminosilicate glass phase, primary reactive component

physical_properties.blaine_fineness_note: Typical for Class F fly ash

chemical_characteristics.notes: High alumina content characteristic of this fly ash source

glass_composition_normalized_wt_percent.note: Approximate glass phase composition, normalized from bulk analysis

reactivity_parameters.note: Glass reactivity to be calibrated against 28-day XRD/TGA data

hydration_products_expected.C_S_H: Primary product from pozzolanic reaction with portlandite
hydration_products_expected.C_A_S_H: Aluminum-substituted C-S-H from high alumina content
hydration_products_expected.stratlingite: Possible formation of C2ASH8 in later stages
hydration_products_expected.hydrotalcite: Mg-Al LDH from reaction with Mg-bearing phases

validation_notes.source: Experimental data from salt attack degradation study
validation_notes.method: XRF for oxide composition, XRD for phase identification
validation_notes.replicate_samples: Consistent with literature values for similar Class F fly ash

comparison_with_cement.notes: Fly ash is silica and alumina-rich, calcium-poor compared to Portland cement
